Understate: The claim may understate the level of press coverage of the 2007 Bush White House email controversy by stating that there was "just about zero press coverage," when there is evidence that some coverage did exist.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that there was "just about zero press coverage" of the 2007 Bush White House email controversy.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the level of media criticism and attention on Clinton's email controversy is unwarranted based on the comparison to the 2007 Bush White House email controversy, without considering other factors or alternative explanations for the difference in coverage.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the difference in media coverage between the Bush and Clinton email controversies, such as differences in the nature or severity of the controversies, political climate, or media landscape at the time.
